li.p: p:insert - Insert a piece of content in another

li.p: p:insert - Insert a piece of content in another

div.p: Insert a piece of content in another

div.pre: <p:declare-step type="p:insert"> <input port="source" primary="true" content-types="xml html" sequence="false"/> <output port="result" primary="true" content-types="xml html" sequence="false"/> <input port="insertion" primary="false" content-types="xml html" sequence="true"/> <option name="match" as="xs:string" required="false" select="/*"/> <option name="position" as="xs:string" required="false" select="after" values="first-child last-child before after"/> </p:declare-step>

div.p: The p:insert step inserts the insertion port's document into the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] port's document relative to the matching elements in the source port's document.
Ports:
Options:

td.p: relative position where to insert the stuff

div.p: The value of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:option> (phase: inline)] option [*** Unrecognized element: <db:rfc2119> (phase: inline)] be an XSLTSelectionPattern. [*** Unrecognized element: <db:error code="C0023"> (phase: inline)] Multiple matches are allowed, in which case multiple copies of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] documents will occur. If no elements match, then the document is unchanged.
The value of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:option> (phase: inline)] option [*** Unrecognized element: <db:rfc2119> (phase: inline)] be an NMTOKEN in the following list:

li.p: “first-child” - the insertion is made as the first child of the match;
“last-child” - the insertion is made as the last child of the match;
“before” - the insertion is made as the immediate preceding sibling of the match;
“after” - the insertion is made as the immediate following sibling of the match.

div.p: As the inserted elements are part of the output of the step they are not considered in determining matching elements. If an empty sequence appears on the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] port, the result will be the same as the source.
[*** Unrecognized element: <db:simplesect> (phase: main)]
This description of the p:insert step is for XProc version: 3.1 .
The formal specification for the p:insert step can be found here .
The p:insert step is part of categories:
Replaces matching nodes

div.pre: <p:declare-step type="p:replace"> <input port="source" primary="true" content-types="xml html" sequence="false"/> <output port="result" primary="true" content-types="text xml html" sequence="false"/> <input port="replacement" primary="false" content-types="text xml html" sequence="false"/> <option name="match" as="xs:string" required="false" select="/*"/> </p:declare-step>

div.p: The p:replace step replaces matching nodes in its primary input with the top-level node(s) of the replacement port's document.
Ports:
Options:

The value of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:option> (phase: inline)] option [*** Unrecognized element: <db:rfc2119> (phase: inline)] be an XSLTSelectionPattern. [*** Unrecognized element: <db:error code="C0023"> (phase: inline)] Multiple matches are allowed, in which case multiple copies of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] document will occur.

Every node in the primary input matching the specified pattern is replaced in the output by the top-level node(s) of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] document. Only non-nested matches are replaced. That is, once a node is replaced, its descendants cannot be matched.

If the document node is matched and port [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] contains a text document, the entire document is replaced by the text node. What appears on port [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] is a text document with the text node wrapped in a document node.

If the resulting document contains exactly one text node, the content-type property is changed to text/plain and the serialization property is removed, while all other document properties are preserved. For other document types, all document properties are preserved.

bla bla bla
This description of the p:replace step is for XProc version: 3.1 .
The formal specification for the p:replace step can be found here .
The p:replace step is part of category: Test .
The p:replace step is also present in version: 3.0 .
The base XProc version 3.0

Replaces matching nodes

div.pre: <p:declare-step type="p:replace"> <input port="source" primary="true" content-types="xml html" sequence="false"/> <output port="result" primary="true" content-types="text xml html" sequence="false"/> <input port="replacement" primary="false" content-types="text xml html" sequence="false"/> <option name="match" as="xs:string" required="false" select="/*"/> </p:declare-step>

div.p: The p:replace step replaces matching nodes in its primary input with the top-level node(s) of the replacement port's document.
Ports:
Options:

The value of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:option> (phase: inline)] option [*** Unrecognized element: <db:rfc2119> (phase: inline)] be an XSLTSelectionPattern. [*** Unrecognized element: <db:error code="C0023"> (phase: inline)] Multiple matches are allowed, in which case multiple copies of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] document will occur.

Every node in the primary input matching the specified pattern is replaced in the output by the top-level node(s) of the [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] document. Only non-nested matches are replaced. That is, once a node is replaced, its descendants cannot be matched.

If the document node is matched and port [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] contains a text document, the entire document is replaced by the text node. What appears on port [*** Unrecognized element: <db:port> (phase: inline)] is a text document with the text node wrapped in a document node.
[*** Unrecognized element: <db:simplesect> (phase: main)]
This description of the p:replace step is for XProc version: 3.0 .
The formal specification for the p:replace step can be found here .
The p:replace step is part of category: Test .
The p:replace step is also present in version: 3.1 .
